comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of September 24, 1911 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00614FA3D5813738... identifies Hedley as Vice President and General Manager of the Interborough Rapid Transit Company and J S Doyle (in another photo nearby in the stream in similar setting) as Superintendent of Car Equipment. Doyle photo:

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The sun. (New York [N.Y.]), February 01, 1916, Page 14, Cols 1 and 2 with photo chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1916-02-01/ed-... reports on the Thompson legislative committee, which was looking into his affairs and activities, including patents held by him and J.S. Doyle (see photo in previous comment), stocks he owned in supplier companies, etc. This might be the context for both photos.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: swanq: I think you are right on all counts regarding the connection and context of this photo and that of Doyle. We'll expand the description on both photos. Thanks!
